meanings.sent1: In the past, people used a prutah to buy things.
meanings.sent2: The prutah was a valuable coin in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: I found a prutah in the old treasure chest, maybe I can buy a tiny castle with it!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny prutah, rare and precious.
meanings.sent5: The prutah gleamed in the sunlight, a piece of history in my hand.

meanings.definition: A very small amount or value
meanings.sent1: He didn't have a prutah left after spending all his money.
meanings.sent2: Every prutah counts when you are saving for a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: I searched my pockets for a prutah to pay for the candy, but all I found was lint!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness meant more to me than any prutah in the world.
meanings.sent5: The prutah of wisdom he shared with me was worth more than gold.
